alert.note: Alert for Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 10:55PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany, southeastern Tangipahoa, southern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 1130 PM CST... At 1055 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Enon to near Madisonville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Bogalusa, Picayune, Covington, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Lacombe, Enon, Crossroads, Bush, Mcneil and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 48 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 3 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
